page.title: 15Rockhouse Bank
page.content: Rockhouse Bank was so named because it was built on a rocky bank in the marshes. There was once a monastery on the Bank but now there are only stone and ruins. You can see the sea from Rockhouse Bank. There is a house now on top of the Bank and one outside wall is painted black to try and lessen the damage from the sea salt spray. The monks dug the ditches around their monastery and made sure that they ran into Waller's Haven which leads to the sea. Most of this land is summer grazing. Much of the marsh is owned by the Nature Conservation Council and it is like a reserve and the farmers are required not to use chemicals (sprays) on this land. {CREDITS} All this information was gathered by the staff and pupils of{ {Hankham C.P.}school.
